alert.note: Alert for Brown; Martin; Nicollet; Redwood; Renville; Sibley; Watonwan (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 30 at 5:21PM CDT until May 30 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR WESTERN SIBLEY...SOUTHEASTERN REDWOOD...NORTHWESTERN MARTIN... BROWN...WESTERN WATONWAN...SOUTHEASTERN RENVILLE AND NORTHWESTERN NICOLLET COUNTIES... At 521 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Morgan to 8 miles east of Comfrey to 6 miles northwest of Trimont, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Morgan around 525 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Sleepy Eye, St. James, Fairfax, Hector, Gibbon, Buffalo Lake, Hanska, Winthrop, New Ulm and Lafayette. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central, central and southwestern Minnesota. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Martin; Nicollet; Redwood; Renville; Sibley; Watonwan
